snippet: A judge will consider claims that there are gaps in New York’s plans to accommodate people with disabilities during events like Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Judge Jesse M Furman of Federal District Court in Manhattan agrees to allow a class-action lawsuit to proceed against New York City alleging systematic failure in addressing the needs of the disabled population in planning for emergencies and disasters.
lead_paragraph: A judge will consider claims that there are gaps in New York’s plans to accommodate people with disabilities during events like Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Suit Proceeds Over City’s Disaster Planning for Disabled People
headline.main: Suit May Go On in Disaster Plan for the Disabled
